00095 /**
00096  * Helper class for meta probesets in apt-data-subset.cpp. Holds a 
00097  * meta probeset name and a list of sub-probesets making up the meta set.
00098  */
00099 class Meta {
00100 public :
00101   string id;  ///< Name/Identifier of the meta probset
00102   vector<string> probeSets; ///< Ids/names of the sub probesets that make up this meta-set
00103 
00104   /// Standard sorting version
00105   bool operator< (const Meta &r) const {
00106     return id < r.id;
00107   }
00108 
00109 };

00112 /**
00113  * Helper class containing information about the subset transformation
00114  * like the set of probesets to be kept and the mapping of original
00115  * probe ids to new probe ids.
00116  */
00117 class FileTranslation {
00118 
00119 public :
00120 
00121   /// Default constructor
00122   FileTranslation() {
00123     totalProbes = 0;
00124     nRow = 0;
00125     nCol = 0;
00126     pOffset = 1;
00127   }
00128  
00129   vector<int> probeMask;  ///< Mapping of original probe_ids (zero based) to new ids. -1 means not in subset
00130   set<string> keepProbeSets; ///< Which probesets will be kept in the new subset
00131   string probeField; ///< Identifier for probe id column in tsv files, usually "probe_id"
00132   string probeSetField; ///< Identifier for probeset id column in tsv files, usually "probeset_id"
00133   string chipType; ///< New chiptype
00134   int totalProbes; ///< How many probes are currently in subset  
00135   int nRow; ///< Number of rows on our spoofed cel file
00136   int nCol; ///< Number of columns on our spoofed cel file
00137   int pOffset; ///< Probe offset, most files this is 1 as they are 1 based, but some can be zero
00138   vector<string> magicOrder;
00139   vector<int> magicOrderTranslation;
00140   map<string,int> magicOrderMap;
00141 
00142   /// Add a probe to our transformation with default offset
00143   bool addProbe(int pId) {
00144     return addProbe(pId, pOffset);
00145   }
00146 
00147   /// Add a probe id to our mapping and transformation array with specified offset
00148   bool addProbe(int pId, int offset) {
00149     pId = pId - offset;
00150     if(probeMask[pId] < 0) {
00151       probeMask[pId] = totalProbes++;
00152       return true;
00153     }
00154     return false;
00155   }
00156 
00157   /**
00158    * Loop through a chip layout and make a mapping with probesets that have been
00159    * chosen to be kept making a map from current probe ids to new probe ids.
00160    */
00161   void fillInFromProbeSets(ChipLayout &layout) {
00162     set<string> keepersSeen;
00163     for(int i = 0; i < layout.getProbeSetCount(); i++) {
00164       ProbeListPacked pl = layout.getProbeListAtIndex(i);
00165 
00166       // Keep the probesets with probes identified
00167       for(int j = 0; j < pl.probe_cnt(); j++) {
00168         if(probeMask[pl.get_probeId(j)] >= 0) {
00169           keepProbeSets.insert(pl.get_name_string());
00170         }
00171       }
00172 
00173       // For probesets identified mark the probes
00174       if( keepProbeSets.find(pl.get_name_string()) != keepProbeSets.end()) {
00175         keepersSeen.insert(pl.get_name_string());
00176         for(int j = 0; j < pl.probe_cnt(); j++) {
00177           int pId = pl.get_probeId(j);
00178           addProbe(pId, 0);
00179         } 
00180       }
00181     }
00182     Verbose::out(2, "Expeting to get: " + ToStr(keepProbeSets.size()) + " but only saw: " + ToStr(keepersSeen.size()) + " probesets in the layout.");
00183     keepProbeSets = keepersSeen;
00184   }
00185 
00186   /// Make a new square chip based on current number of probes.
00187   void calcDimensions(int totalProbes) {
00188       double sq = sqrt(totalProbes);
00189       int width = Util::round(ceil(sq));
00190       nRow = width;
00191       nCol = width;
00192   }
00193 
00194 };

00250   }

00371 /// Open an Spf file and write out the headers
00372 void openSpfForWrite(affx::SpfFile& spffile,const std::string& fileName, 
00373                      const std::string &chipType, int version, int nCol, int nRow, int psCount,
00374                      int nChannels) {
00375   // the standard set of columns
00376   spffile.define_file(version);
00377   // stuff what will appear in the headers into the vars...
00378   spffile.m_header_chipTypes.clear();
00379   spffile.m_header_chipTypes.push_back(chipType);
00380   spffile.m_header_numProbesets=psCount;
00381   spffile.m_header_numCols=nCol;
00382   spffile.m_header_numRows=nRow;
00383   spffile.m_header_numChannels=nChannels;
00384   if(version == 4) {
00385     spffile.m_has_allele_info = 1;
00386     spffile.m_has_context_info = 1;
00387     spffile.m_has_channel_info = 1;
00388     spffile.m_has_rep_type_info = 1;
00389   }
00390   // ...and this will add the headers in the standard order.
00391   spffile.addStandardHeaders();
00392   // ready for data.
00393   spffile.writeSpf(fileName, version);
00394 }
00395 
00396 /// Open a tsv file and read the cel files we want to process
00397 void fillInCelFiles(vector<string> &celFiles, const string &fileName) {
00398   celFiles.clear();
00399   affx::TsvFile tsv;
00400 #ifdef WIN32
00401   tsv.m_optEscapeOk = false;
00402 #endif
00403   string file;
00404   tsv.bind(0, "cel_files", &file, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00405   if(tsv.open(fileName) != TSV_OK) {
00406     Err::errAbort("Couldn't open cell-files file: " + fileName);
00407   }
00408   tsv.rewind();
00409   while(tsv.nextLevel(0) == TSV_OK) {
00410     celFiles.push_back(file);
00411   }
00412   tsv.close();
00413   Verbose::out(1, "Read " + ToStr(celFiles.size()) + " cel filenames from: " + Fs::basename(fileName));
00414 }
00415 
00416 /// Open up a tsv file and read the collection of tsv files that we are going to want to process
00417 void fillInTsvFiles(vector<string> &tsvFiles, vector<string> &ids, const string &fileName) {
00418   tsvFiles.clear();
00419   affx::TsvFile tsv;
00420 #ifdef WIN32
00421   tsv.m_optEscapeOk = false;
00422 #endif
00423   string file;
00424   string id;
00425   tsv.bind(0, "tsv_files", &file, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00426   tsv.bind(0, "probeset_field", &id, TSV_BIND_OPTIONAL);
00427   if(tsv.open(fileName) != TSV_OK) {
00428     Err::errAbort("Couldn't open tsv-files file: " + fileName);
00429   }
00430   tsv.rewind();
00431   while(tsv.nextLevel(0) == TSV_OK) {
00432     tsvFiles.push_back(file);
00433     ids.push_back(id);
00434   }
00435   tsv.close();
00436   Verbose::out(1, "Read " + ToStr(tsvFiles.size()) + " tsv filenames from: " + Fs::basename(fileName));
00437 }
00438 
00439 /// Open up a tsv file and read the collection of tsv files that we are going to want to process
00440 void fillInFile5Files(vector<File5Options> &file5Files,  const string &inputName) {
00441   file5Files.clear();
00442   affx::TsvFile tsv;
00443 #ifdef WIN32
00444   tsv.m_optEscapeOk = false;
00445 #endif
00446   string file;
00447   string group;
00448   string probeId;
00449   string probesetId;
00450   int idOffset;
00451   tsv.bind(0, "file5_group", &group, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00452   tsv.bind(0, "probe_id_field", &probeId, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00453   tsv.bind(0, "probe_id_offset", &idOffset, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00454   tsv.bind(0, "probeset_field", &probesetId, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00455   tsv.bind(0, "file5_file", &file, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00456   if(tsv.open(inputName) != TSV_OK) {
00457     Err::errAbort("Couldn't open tsv-files file: " + inputName);
00458   }
00459   tsv.rewind();
00460   while(tsv.nextLevel(0) == TSV_OK) {
00461     File5Options f5Opts;
00462     f5Opts.fileName = file;
00463     f5Opts.groupName = group;
00464     f5Opts.probeId = probeId;
00465     f5Opts.idOffset = idOffset;
00466     f5Opts.probeSetId = probesetId;
00467 
00468     file5Files.push_back(f5Opts);
00469   }
00470   tsv.close();
00471   Verbose::out(1, "Read " + ToStr(file5Files.size()) + " file5 filenames from: " + Fs::basename(inputName));
00472 }

00475 
00476 /// Write a subset of cel file to a new file
00477 void makeCelFileSubset(const string &orig, const string &outCel, 
00478                         const FileTranslation &trans) {
00479   FusionCELData cel;
00480   cel.SetFileName(orig.c_str());
00481   cel.Read();
00482   if(!cel.Read()) 
00483     Err::errAbort("\nCan't read cel file: " + cel.GetFileName() + 
00484                   "\n>>> Error reported: " + StringUtils::ConvertWCSToMBS(cel.GetError()));
00485   int numCells = cel.GetNumCells();
00486   int newNumCells = trans.nRow * trans.nCol;
00487 
00488   vector<float> intensities(newNumCells);
00489   fill(intensities.begin(), intensities.end(), 0.0f);
00490   vector<float> stdevs(newNumCells);
00491   fill(stdevs.begin(), stdevs.end(), 0.0f);
00492   vector<int16_t>  nPixels(newNumCells);
00493   fill(nPixels.begin(), nPixels.end(), 0);
00494 
00495   CelFileData out(outCel.c_str());
00496   out.SetCols(trans.nCol);
00497   out.SetRows(trans.nRow);
00498   out.SetArrayType(StringUtils::ConvertMBSToWCS(trans.chipType));
00499   out.SetIntensityCount(newNumCells);
00500   out.SetStdDevCount(newNumCells);
00501   out.SetPixelCount(newNumCells);
00502   CelFileWriter writer(out);
00503 
00504   for(int featIx = 0; featIx < numCells; featIx++) {
00505     if(trans.probeMask[featIx] >= 0) {
00506       intensities[trans.probeMask[featIx]] = cel.GetIntensity(featIx);
00507       stdevs[trans.probeMask[featIx]] = cel.GetStdv(featIx);
00508       nPixels[trans.probeMask[featIx]] = cel.GetPixels(featIx);
00509     }
00510   }
00511   writer.WriteStdDevs(stdevs);
00512   writer.WriteIntensities(intensities);
00513   writer.WritePixels(nPixels);
00514 }
00515

00572 //     beginNvT++;
00573 //   }
00574 //   outFileHdr.AddDataGroupHdr(dstGrp);
00575 //   gReader.Clear();
00576 // }

00615 /// Write a subset of cel file to a new file
00616 void makeMultiCelFileSubset(const string &orig, const string &outCel, 
00617                         const FileTranslation &trans) {
00618   FusionCELData cel;
00619   cel.SetFileName(orig.c_str());
00620   cel.Read();
00621   
00622   if(!cel.Read()) 
00623     Err::errAbort("\nCan't read cel file: " + cel.GetFileName() + 
00624                   "\n>>> Error reported: " + StringUtils::ConvertWCSToMBS(cel.GetError()));
00625   WStringVector channelVec = cel.GetChannels();
00626   if(channelVec.size() != 2) {
00627     Err::errAbort("Expecting 2 channels but got: " + ToStr(channelVec.size()) + " in file: " + orig);
00628   }
00629   vector<string> tmpFileNamesToDelete;
00630   for(int i = 0; i < channelVec.size(); i++) {
00631     cel.SetActiveDataGroup(channelVec[i]);
00632     int numCells = cel.GetNumCells();
00633     int newNumCells = trans.nRow * trans.nCol;
00634     
00635     vector<float> intensities(newNumCells);
00636     fill(intensities.begin(), intensities.end(), 0.0f);
00637     vector<float> stdevs(newNumCells);
00638     fill(stdevs.begin(), stdevs.end(), 0.0f);
00639     vector<int16_t>  nPixels(newNumCells);
00640     fill(nPixels.begin(), nPixels.end(), 0);
00641     string tempFile = "celFile." + StringUtils::ConvertWCSToMBS(channelVec[i]) + "." + ToStr(i) + ".cel";
00642     tmpFileNamesToDelete.push_back(tempFile);
00643     CelFileData out(tempFile);
00644 
00645     /* Have to copy over all the parent headers as the CELData.cpp code won't recognize
00646        this as a multi-channel cel file unless there is a parent GenericDataHeader named
00647        MULTI_SCAN_ACQUISITION_DATA_TYPE ("affymetrix-calvin-multi-scan-acquisition"). 
00648        Apparently this is from the original dat file used for this cel file. Implying that
00649        Cel files only come from DAT files... */
00650     GenericDataHeader *inSrc =  cel.GetGenericData()->Header().GetGenericDataHdr();
00651     GenericDataHeader *outDst = out.GetGenericData().Header().GetGenericDataHdr();
00652     GenDataHdrVectorIt begin, end;
00653     inSrc->GetParentIterators(begin, end);
00654     while(begin != end)      {
00655       outDst->AddParent(*begin);
00656       begin++;
00657     }    
00658     //    out.SetActiveChannel(channelVec[i]);
00659     
00660     GenericDataHeader *hdr = out.GetGenericData().Header().GetGenericDataHdr();
00661     ParameterNameValueType pFilt;
00662     pFilt.SetName(FILTER_PARAM_NAME);
00663     pFilt.SetValueText(channelVec[i]);
00664     hdr->AddNameValParam(pFilt);
00665     ParameterNameValueType p;
00666     //    hdr->SetFileTypeId(INTENSITY_DATA_TYPE);
00667     p.SetName(AFFY_FILTER_WAVELENGTH);
00668     p.SetValueText(channelVec[i]);
00669     hdr->AddNameValParam(p);
00670     out.SetCols(trans.nCol);
00671     out.SetRows(trans.nRow);
00672     out.SetArrayType(StringUtils::ConvertMBSToWCS(trans.chipType));
00673     out.SetIntensityCount(newNumCells);
00674     out.SetStdDevCount(newNumCells);
00675     out.SetPixelCount(newNumCells);
00676     CelFileWriter writer(out);
00677 
00678     for(int featIx = 0; featIx < numCells; featIx++) {
00679       if(trans.probeMask[featIx] >= 0) {
00680         intensities[trans.probeMask[featIx]] = cel.GetIntensity(featIx);
00681         stdevs[trans.probeMask[featIx]] = cel.GetStdv(featIx);
00682         nPixels[trans.probeMask[featIx]] = cel.GetPixels(featIx);
00683       }
00684     }
00685     writer.WriteStdDevs(stdevs);
00686     writer.WriteIntensities(intensities);
00687     writer.WritePixels(nPixels);
00688   }
00689   MultiChannelCelFileCollater collator;
00690   collator.Collate(tmpFileNamesToDelete, outCel);
00691    { for( int i=0; i < tmpFileNamesToDelete.size();  i++ ) { Fs::rm(tmpFileNamesToDelete[i], false);} } ;
00692 }
00693 
00694 void subsetCelFile(const string &orig, const string &outCel, 
00695                         const FileTranslation &trans) {
00696   FusionCELData cel;
00697   cel.SetFileName(orig.c_str());
00698   cel.Read();
00699   if(!cel.Read()) 
00700     Err::errAbort("\nCan't read cel file: " + cel.GetFileName() + 
00701                   "\n>>> Error reported: " + StringUtils::ConvertWCSToMBS(cel.GetError()));
00702   WStringVector channelVec = cel.GetChannels();
00703   cel.Close();
00704   if(channelVec.size() <= 1) {
00705     makeCelFileSubset(orig, outCel, trans);
00706   }
00707   else {
00708     makeMultiCelFileSubset(orig, outCel,trans);
00709   }
00710 }
00711 
00712 /// Update the bgp files with new probe ids for appropriate bgp entries
00713 void convertBgpFile(vector<int> &probeMask, const string &chipType,
00714                     const string &bgpFileIn, const string &bgpFileOut ) {
00715   affx::BgpFile bgp;
00716   affx::BgpFile bgpOut;
00717   bgpOut.m_tsv.defineFile("probe_id\ttype\tgc_count\n");
00718   bgpOut.m_tsv.addHeader("chip_type",chipType);
00719   bgpOut.m_tsv.addHeader("lib_set_name",chipType);
00720 
00721   bgpOut.m_tsv.writeTsv_v1(bgpFileOut);
00722   if (bgp.open(bgpFileIn)!=TSV_OK) {
00723     Err::errAbort("Unable to open "+ToStr(bgpFileIn));
00724   }
00725 
00726   while (bgp.next_bgprobe()==TSV_OK) {
00727     int pId = probeMask[bgp.probe_id-1];  // NOTE: -1 because this probe_id is 1-based.
00728     if(pId < 0) {
00729       Err::errAbort("Can't have pId < 0");
00730     }
00731     bgpOut.m_tsv.set(0,"probe_id",pId);
00732     bgpOut.m_tsv.set(0, "type", bgp.type);
00733     bgpOut.m_tsv.set(0,"gc_count",bgp.gc_count);
00734     bgpOut.m_tsv.writeLevel(0);
00735   }
00736   bgpOut.close();
00737   bgp.close();
00738 }
00739 
00740 /// Set the bgp probes and probesets to be kept
00741 void setBgpFile(FileTranslation &trans, string &bgpFile) {
00742   affx::BgpFile bgp;
00743   if (bgp.open(bgpFile)!=TSV_OK) {
00744     Err::errAbort("Unable to open "+ToStr(bgpFile));
00745   }
00746 
00747   while (bgp.next_bgprobe()==TSV_OK) {
00748     int pId = bgp.probe_id;
00749     trans.addProbe(pId);
00750     trans.keepProbeSets.insert(ToStr(bgp.probeset_id_1));
00751   }
00752   bgp.close();
00753 }
00754 
00755 /// Copy a tsv record from one tsv-file to another
00756 void copyRow(TsvFile &in, TsvFile &out, int level, const FileTranslation &trans) {
00757   string s;
00758   int pId = -1;
00759   for(int cidx = 0; cidx < in.getColumnCount(level); cidx++) {
00760     if(in.get(level,cidx,s) == TSV_OK) {
00761       if(in.getColumnName(level, cidx) == trans.probeField) {
00762         pId = Convert::toInt(s) - trans.pOffset;
00763         pId = trans.probeMask[pId];
00764         if(pId < 0) {
00765           Err::errAbort("Shouldn't get -1 in the probeMask for pId: " + s + " at column: " + in.getColumnName(level, cidx) + " at " + ToStr(level) + " in: " + in.getFileName() + " with offset: " + ToStr(trans.pOffset) + " at line: " + ToStr(in.lineNumber()));
00766         }
00767         s = ToStr(pId + trans.pOffset);
00768       }
00769       else if((in.getColumnName(level, cidx) == "y" || in.getColumnName(level,cidx) == "Probe Y") && pId >= 0) {
00770         int y = pId / trans.nCol;
00771         s = ToStr(y);
00772       }
00773       else if((in.getColumnName(level, cidx) == "x" || in.getColumnName(level,cidx) == "Probe X") && pId >= 0) {
00774         int x = pId % trans.nCol;
00775         s = ToStr(x);
00776       }
00777       out.set(level, cidx, s);
00778     }
00779     else {
00780       Err::errAbort("Error - Bad read in: " + in.getFileName() + " at line number " + ToStr(in.lineNumber()) +  " at level: " + ToStr(level));
00781     }
00782   }
00783   out.writeLevel(level);
00784 }
00785 
00786 /// Recursively copy rows from one tsv-file to another
00787 void recursiveWrite(TsvFile &in, TsvFile &out, int level, const FileTranslation &trans) {
00788   string s;
00789   while(in.nextLevel(level) == TSV_OK) {
00790     copyRow(in, out, level, trans);
00791     if(level < in.getLevelCount() -1) {
00792       recursiveWrite(in, out, level+1, trans);
00793     }
00794   }
00795 }
00796 
00797 /**
00798  * Copy all the headers with the exception of chip_type which is supplied
00799  */
00800 void copyTsvHeaders(TsvFile &in, TsvFile &out, const map<string,string> &replace) {
00801   string key;
00802   string value;
00803   while(in.headersNext(key, value) == TSV_OK) {
00804     if(replace.find(key) != replace.end()) {
00805       value = replace.find(key)->second;
00806     }
00807     out.addHeader(key,value);
00808   }
00809 }
00810 
00811 /**
00812  * Copy over the "format" of one tsvfile to another
00813  */ 
00814 void copyTsvDefinition(TsvFile &in, TsvFile &out) {
00815   out.copyFormat(in);
00816 }
00817 
00818 /// Based on the probesets and probes in the translation object determine if we're keeping this tsv row
00819 bool keepRow(TsvFile &in, int level,
00820              const FileTranslation &trans) {
00821   string s;
00822   string pString;
00823   if(trans.probeSetField == "*") 
00824     return true;
00825   for(int cidx = 0; cidx < in.getColumnCount(level); cidx++) {
00826     if(in.get(level,cidx,s) == TSV_OK) {
00827       string colName = in.getColumnName(level, cidx);
00828       if(colName == trans.probeField) {
00829         pString = s;
00830         int pId = Convert::toInt(s);
00831         pId = trans.probeMask[pId-trans.pOffset];
00832         if(pId >= 0) {
00833           return true;
00834         }
00835       }
00836       if(colName == trans.probeSetField) {
00837         string s2;
00838         size_t x = s.rfind(":");
00839         if(x != string::npos) {
00840           s2 = s.substr(0,x);
00841         }
00842         if(trans.keepProbeSets.find(s) != trans.keepProbeSets.end() || trans.keepProbeSets.find(s2) != trans.keepProbeSets.end()) {
00843           return true;
00844         }
00845       }
00846     }
00847   }
00848   return false;
00849 }
00850 
00851 /// Based on the probesets and probes in the translation object determine if we're keeping this tsv row
00852 bool keepRow(File5_Tsv &in, int level, File5Options &f5Opts, const FileTranslation &trans, int lineCount) {
00853   string s;
00854   string pString;
00855   string colName;
00856   int pId = 0;
00857   if(f5Opts.probeSetId == "*") 
00858     return true;
00859   for(int cidx = 0; cidx < in.getColumnCount(level); cidx++) {
00860     affx::File5_dtype_t type = in.getColumnDtype(level,cidx);
00861     if(type == FILE5_DTYPE_INT) {
00862       in.getColumnName(level, cidx, &colName);
00863       if(colName == f5Opts.probeId) {
00864         in.get(level, cidx, &pId);
00865         pId = trans.probeMask[pId - f5Opts.idOffset];
00866         if(pId >= 0) {
00867           return true;
00868         }
00869       }
00870     }
00871     else if(type == FILE5_DTYPE_STRING) {
00872       in.getColumnName(level, cidx, &colName);
00873       if(colName == f5Opts.probeSetId) {
00874         in.get(level,cidx,&s);
00875         string s2;
00876         size_t x = s.rfind(":");
00877         if(x != string::npos) {
00878           s2 = s.substr(0,x);
00879         }
00880         if(trans.keepProbeSets.find(s) != trans.keepProbeSets.end() || trans.keepProbeSets.find(s2) != trans.keepProbeSets.end()) {
00881           return true;
00882         }
00883       }
00884     }
00885     else if(type == FILE5_DTYPE_DOUBLE) {
00886       in.getColumnName(level, cidx, &colName);
00887       if(colName.find('X') == 0) {
00888         return trans.magicOrderTranslation[lineCount] >= 0;
00889       }
00890     }
00891   }
00892   return false;
00893 }
00894 
00895 int adjustColumn(File5_Tsv &in, string &colName, int value, File5Options &f5Opts, const FileTranslation &trans) {
00896   int adjusted = value;
00897   if(colName == f5Opts.probeId) {
00898     adjusted = value - f5Opts.idOffset;
00899     adjusted = trans.probeMask[adjusted];
00900     if(adjusted < 0) {
00901       Err::errAbort("Shouldn't get -1 in the probeMask for pId: " + ToStr(value) + " at column: " + colName + " with offset: " + ToStr(trans.pOffset));
00902     }
00903     adjusted = adjusted + f5Opts.idOffset;
00904   }
00905   else if((colName == "y" || colName == "Probe Y") && adjusted >= 0) {
00906     adjusted = adjusted / trans.nCol;
00907     
00908   }
00909   else if((colName == "x" || colName == "Probe X") && adjusted >= 0) {
00910     adjusted = adjusted % trans.nCol;
00911   }
00912   return adjusted;
00913 }
00914 
00915 void checkRet(int retVal, int level, int col, File5_Tsv &tsv5) {
00916   if(retVal != FILE5_OK) {
00917     string colName;
00918     tsv5.getColumnName(level, col, &colName);
00919     Err::errAbort("Error: bad return value at column: " + colName + " level " + ToStr(level) + " column: " + ToStr(col));
00920   }
00921 }
00922 
00923 void copyColumn(File5_Tsv &in, File5_Tsv &out, File5Options &f5Opts,
00924                 int level, int colIx, const FileTranslation &trans) {
00925 
00926   affx::File5_dtype_t type = in.getColumnDtype(level,colIx);
00927   int ival = 0;
00928   float fval = 0.0f;
00929   double dval = 0.0f;
00930   string sval;
00931   string colName;
00932   int ret = 0;
00933   switch (type) {
00934     
00935   case FILE5_DTYPE_INT :
00936     colName = "";
00937     ret = in.getColumnName(level, colIx, &colName);
00938     checkRet(ret, level, colIx, in);
00939     ret = in.get(level,colIx,&ival);
00940     checkRet(ret, level, colIx, in);
00941     ival = adjustColumn(in, colName, ival, f5Opts, trans);
00942     if(colName == "ProbeSetIndex") {
00943       int psIndex = trans.magicOrderTranslation[ival];
00944       ret = out.set_i(level,colIx,psIndex);
00945     }
00946     else 
00947       ret = out.set_i(level,colIx,ival);
00948     checkRet(ret, level, colIx, out);
00949     break;
00950   case FILE5_DTYPE_FLOAT :
00951     ret = in.get(level,colIx,&fval);
00952     checkRet(ret, level, colIx, in);
00953     ret = out.set_f(level,colIx,fval);
00954     checkRet(ret, level, colIx, out);
00955     break;
00956   case FILE5_DTYPE_DOUBLE :
00957     ret = in.get(level,colIx,&dval);
00958     checkRet(ret, level, colIx, in);
00959     ret = out.set_d(level,colIx,dval);
00960     checkRet(ret, level, colIx, out);
00961     break;
00962   case FILE5_DTYPE_STRING : 
00963     ret = in.get(level,colIx,&sval);
00964     checkRet(ret, level, colIx, in);
00965     ret = out.set_string(level,colIx,sval);
00966     checkRet(ret, level, colIx, out);
00967     break;
00968   case FILE5_DTYPE_UNKNOWN:
00969   case FILE5_DTYPE_ERR:
00970   case FILE5_DTYPE_ANY:
00971   default:
00972     Err::errAbort("Unknown Type - Unhandled case.");
00973 
00974   }
00975 }
00976 
00977 void copyRow(File5_Tsv &in, File5_Tsv &out, File5Options &f5Opts, int level, const FileTranslation &trans) {
00978   for(int cidx = 0; cidx < in.getColumnCount(level); cidx++) {
00979     copyColumn(in, out, f5Opts, level, cidx, trans);
00980   }
00981   out.writeLevel(level);
00982 }
00983 
00984 /// Recursively copy rows from one tsv-file to another
00985 void recursiveWrite(File5_Tsv &in, File5_Tsv &out, File5Options &f5Opts, int level, const FileTranslation &trans) {
00986   string s;
00987   while(in.nextLevel(level) == FILE5_OK) {
00988     copyRow(in, out, f5Opts, level, trans);
00989     if(level < in.getLevelCount() -1) {
00990       recursiveWrite(in, out, f5Opts, level+1, trans);
00991     }
00992   }
00993 }
00994 
00995 /// Copy the appropriate entries from the input tsv file into the output tsv file.
00996 void copyTsvFile(const string &in, const string &out, const map<string,string> &replace,
00997                  const FileTranslation &trans) {
00998   TsvFile iTsv;
00999   TsvFile oTsv;
01000   iTsv.open(in);
01001   copyTsvDefinition(iTsv, oTsv);
01002   copyTsvHeaders(iTsv, oTsv, replace);
01003   if(iTsv.getLevelCount() == 1) {
01004     oTsv.writeTsv_v1(out);
01005   }
01006   else {
01007     oTsv.writeTsv(out);
01008   }
01009   int level = 0;
01010   int seen = 0, kept = 0;
01011   while(iTsv.nextLevel(level) == TSV_OK) {
01012     seen++;
01013     if(keepRow(iTsv, level, trans)) {
01014       kept++;
01015       copyRow(iTsv, oTsv, level, trans);
01016       recursiveWrite(iTsv, oTsv,level+1, trans);
01017     }
01018   }
01019   iTsv.close();
01020   oTsv.close();
01021   Verbose::out(2, "Copy tsv: Saw " + ToStr(seen) + " and kept " + ToStr(kept) + " in file " + in);
01022 }
01023 
01024 /// Copy the appropriate entries from the input tsv file into the output tsv file.
01025 void copyFile5File(File5Options f5Opts, const string &out,
01026                    const FileTranslation &trans) {
01027   int ret;
01028   affx::File5_File iFile5;      
01029   Verbose::out(2,"Opening " + f5Opts.fileName + " with group " + f5Opts.groupName + " to read.");
01030   ret = iFile5.open(f5Opts.fileName, affx::FILE5_OPEN_RO);
01031   if(ret != FILE5_OK) {
01032     Err::errAbort("Couldn't open file: " + f5Opts.fileName);
01033   }
01034   Verbose::out(2,"Opening " + out + " with group " + f5Opts.groupName + " to write.");
01035   affx::File5_File oFile5;      
01036   ret = oFile5.open(out, affx::FILE5_OPEN_CREATE);
01037   if(ret != FILE5_OK) {
01038     Err::errAbort("Couldn't open file: " + out);
01039   }
01040   
01041   affx::File5_Group* iGroup5 = iFile5.openGroup(f5Opts.groupName, affx::FILE5_OPEN);
01042   affx::File5_Group* oGroup5 = oFile5.openGroup(f5Opts.groupName, affx::FILE5_OPEN_CREATE);
01043   affx::File5_Tsv* iTsv5 = iGroup5->openTsv(f5Opts.groupName, affx::FILE5_OPEN);
01044   affx::File5_Tsv* oTsv5 = oGroup5->openTsv(f5Opts.groupName, affx::FILE5_OPEN_CREATE);
01045 
01046   oTsv5->copyFormat(*iTsv5);
01047   int level = 0;
01048   int seenCount = 0;
01049   int keepCount = 0;
01050   while(iTsv5->nextLevel(level) == affx::FILE5_OK) {
01051 
01052     // @todo - fix this hack to figure out what ProbeSetIndex the values for reference file are...
01053     if(keepRow(*iTsv5, level, f5Opts, trans, seenCount++)) {
01054       keepCount++;
01055       copyRow(*iTsv5, *oTsv5, f5Opts, level, trans);
01056     }
01057   }
01058   Verbose::out(2, "Saw " + ToStr(seenCount) + " and kept " + ToStr(keepCount) + " records.");
01059   iTsv5->close();
01060   oTsv5->close();
01061   delete iTsv5;
01062   delete oTsv5;
01063 
01064   iGroup5->close();
01065   oGroup5->close();
01066   delete iGroup5;
01067   delete oGroup5;
01068 
01069   iFile5.close();
01070   oFile5.close();
01071 }
01072 
01073 /// Read a tsv row and see if it has a probe or probeset we want to keep
01074 bool readTsvProbesetRow(TsvFile &in, int level, FileTranslation &trans, set<string> &probeSets) {
01075   string s;
01076   bool ret = false;
01077   for(int cidx = 0; cidx < in.getColumnCount(level); cidx++) {
01078     if(in.get(level,cidx,s) == TSV_OK) {
01079       string colName = in.getColumnName(level, cidx);
01080       if(colName == trans.probeSetField) {
01081         probeSets.insert(s);
01082         ret = true;
01083       }
01084       else if(colName == trans.probeField) {
01085         int pId = Convert::toInt(s);
01086         trans.addProbe(pId);
01087         ret = true;
01088       }
01089     }
01090   }
01091   return ret;
01092 }
01093 
01094 /// Recursively loop through tsv entries looking for probes and probesets to keep
01095 void recursiveRead(TsvFile &in, int level, FileTranslation &trans, set<string> &probeSets) {
01096   string s;
01097   while(in.nextLevel(level) == TSV_OK) {
01098     readTsvProbesetRow(in, level, trans, probeSets);
01099     if(level < in.getLevelCount() -1) {
01100       recursiveRead(in, level+1, trans, probeSets);
01101     }
01102   }
01103 }
01104 
01105 //
01106 void readProbesetTsvFile(const string &fileName, FileTranslation &trans, int numKeep) {
01107   TsvFile in;
01108   in.open(fileName);
01109   int level = 0;
01110   set<string> probeSets;
01111   int count = 0;
01112   int kept = 0;
01113   while(in.nextLevel(level) == TSV_OK) {
01114     if(readTsvProbesetRow(in, level, trans, probeSets)) {
01115       kept++;
01116     }
01117     recursiveRead(in, level+1, trans, probeSets);
01118     count++;
01119   }
01120   in.close();
01121   Verbose::out(2, "Saw " + ToStr(count) + " and kept " + ToStr(kept) + " in file " + fileName);
01122   vector<string> toAdd(min((size_t)numKeep,probeSets.size()));
01123   srand(1);
01124   random_sample(probeSets.begin(), probeSets.end(), toAdd.begin(), toAdd.end());
01125   sort(toAdd.begin(), toAdd.end());
01126   for(vector<string>::iterator iter = toAdd.begin(); iter != toAdd.end(); iter++) {
01127     trans.keepProbeSets.insert(*iter);
01128   }
01129 }
01130 
01131 void readFile5ProbesetRow(File5_Tsv &iTsv5, File5Options &f5Opts, int level, FileTranslation &trans,
01132                           int &probeId, int &probesetId) {
01133   int nothingCount;
01134   for(int cidx = 0; cidx < iTsv5.getColumnCount(level); cidx++) {
01135     affx::File5_dtype_t type = iTsv5.getColumnDtype(level,cidx);
01136     int ival = 0;
01137     string sval;
01138     string colName;
01139     int ret = 0;
01140     switch (type) {
01141     case FILE5_DTYPE_INT :
01142       colName = "";
01143       ret = iTsv5.getColumnName(level, cidx, &colName);
01144       checkRet(ret, level, cidx, iTsv5);
01145       ret = iTsv5.get(level,cidx,&ival);
01146       checkRet(ret, level, cidx, iTsv5);
01147       if(colName == f5Opts.probeId) {
01148         if(trans.addProbe(ival, f5Opts.idOffset))
01149           probeId++;
01150       }
01151       break;
01152     case FILE5_DTYPE_STRING : 
01153       colName = "";
01154 
01155       ret = iTsv5.getColumnName(level, cidx, &colName);
01156       checkRet(ret, level, cidx, iTsv5);
01157 
01158       ret = iTsv5.get(level,cidx,&sval);
01159       checkRet(ret, level, cidx, iTsv5);
01160       
01161       if(colName == f5Opts.probeSetId) {
01162         pair<set<string>::iterator,bool> rVal = trans.keepProbeSets.insert(sval);
01163         if(rVal.second) {
01164           probesetId++;
01165         }
01166       }
01167 
01168       break;
01169     case FILE5_DTYPE_UNKNOWN:
01170     case FILE5_DTYPE_ERR:
01171     case FILE5_DTYPE_ANY:
01172     default:
01173       // do nothing
01174       nothingCount++;
01175     }
01176   }
01177 }
01178 
01179 //
01180 void readProbesetFile5File(File5Options &f5Opts, FileTranslation &trans) {
01181   int ret;
01182   affx::File5_File iFile5;      
01183   Verbose::out(2,"Opening " + f5Opts.fileName + " with group " + f5Opts.groupName + " to read.");
01184   ret = iFile5.open(f5Opts.fileName, affx::FILE5_OPEN_RO);
01185   if(ret != FILE5_OK) {
01186     Err::errAbort("Couldn't open file: " + f5Opts.fileName);
01187   }
01188   affx::File5_Group* iGroup5 = iFile5.openGroup(f5Opts.groupName, affx::FILE5_OPEN);
01189   affx::File5_Tsv* iTsv5 = iGroup5->openTsv(f5Opts.groupName, affx::FILE5_OPEN);
01190   int level = 0;
01191   set<string> probeSets;
01192   int probesetCount = 0, probeCount = 0, seenCount = 0;
01193   while(iTsv5->nextLevel(level) == affx::FILE5_OK) {
01194     readFile5ProbesetRow(*iTsv5, f5Opts, level, trans, probeCount, probesetCount);
01195     seenCount++;
01196   }
01197   Verbose::out(2, "Saw " + ToStr(seenCount) + " and kept " + ToStr(probeCount) + " probe records and " + ToStr(probesetCount) + " probeset records");
01198   iTsv5->close();
01199   delete iTsv5;
01200   iGroup5->close();
01201   delete iGroup5;
01202   
01203   iFile5.close();
01204 }
01205 
01206 void readMetaProbesetList(vector<Meta> &toLoad, const string &metaFile, int numLoad){
01207   string probeset, probesetList;
01208   vector<Meta> sets;
01209   vector<string> words;
01210   TsvFile tsv;
01211   // open file and make sure that it has at least a probeset_id column
01212   if(tsv.open(metaFile) != TSV_OK) 
01213     Err::errAbort("Couldn't open file: '" + ToStr(metaFile) + "'");
01214   tsv.bind(0, "probeset_id", &probeset, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
01215   // list of probesets can be either called probeset_list or 
01216   if(tsv.cname2cidx(0, "probeset_list") != TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND)
01217     tsv.bind(0, "probeset_list", &probesetList, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
01218   else if(tsv.cname2cidx(0, "probeset_ids") != TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND)
01219     tsv.bind(0, "probeset_ids", &probesetList, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
01220   else
01221     Err::errAbort("Meta probeset list must contain 'probeset_list'");
01222 
01223   set<string> seen;
01224   while(tsv.nextLevel(0) == TSV_OK) {
01225     Meta m;
01226     m.id = probeset;
01227     Util::chopString(probesetList, ' ', m.probeSets);
01228     sets.push_back(m);
01229   }
01230     
01231   tsv.close();
01232   toLoad.clear();
01233   toLoad.resize(numLoad);
01234   srand(1);
01235   random_sample(sets.begin(), sets.end(), toLoad.begin(), toLoad.end());
01236   sort(toLoad.begin(), toLoad.end());
01237 }
01238 
01239 void fillPsNamesFromLayout(set<string> &keepProbeSets, ChipLayout &layout, int numKeep) {
01240   // - For each probsets to be kept mark the probes to be kept
01241   vector<string> psNames(layout.getProbeSetCount());
01242   vector<string> psSample(numKeep);
01243   fill(psSample.begin(), psSample.end(), -1);
01244   for(int i = 0; i < layout.getProbeSetCount(); i++) 
01245     psNames[i] = layout.getProbeListAtIndex(i).get_name_string();
01246   srand(1);
01247   random_sample(psNames.begin(), psNames.end(), psSample.begin(), psSample.end());
01248   //  sort(psSample.begin(), psSample.end());
01249   for(int i = 0; i < psSample.size(); i++) {
01250     keepProbeSets.insert(psSample[i]);
01251   }
01252 
01253 }
01254 
01255 void writeMetaProbesets(vector<Meta> &metaSets, const string &fileName, const string &chipType) {
01256   TsvFile tsv;
01257   tsv.defineFile("probeset_id\tprobeset_list\n");
01258   tsv.addHeader("chip_type", chipType);
01259   tsv.addHeader("lib_set_name", chipType);
01260   tsv.writeTsv_v1(fileName);
01261   for(int i = 0; i < metaSets.size(); i++) {
01262     tsv.set(0,"probeset_id",metaSets[i].id);
01263     string list = metaSets[i].probeSets[0];
01264     for(int j = 1; j < metaSets[i].probeSets.size(); j++) {
01265       list += " " + metaSets[i].probeSets[j];
01266     }
01267     tsv.set(0,"probeset_list", list);
01268     tsv.writeLevel(0);
01269   }
01270   tsv.close();
01271 }
01272 
01273 void writeSpfFile(ChipLayout &layout, 
01274                   const string &outputSpf, 
01275                   const FileTranslation &trans,
01276                   int version, int nChannels) {
01277   SpfFile outSpf;
01278   openSpfForWrite(outSpf, outputSpf, trans.chipType, version, trans.nCol, trans.nRow, trans.keepProbeSets.size(), nChannels);
01279   int written = 0;
01280   set<string> working;
01281   for(int i = 0; i < layout.getProbeSetCount(); i++) {
01282     ProbeListPacked pl = layout.getProbeListAtIndex(i);
01283     if( trans.keepProbeSets.find(pl.get_name_string()) != trans.keepProbeSets.end()) {
01284       for(int j = 0; j < pl.probe_cnt(); j++) {
01285         int pId = pl.get_probeId(j);
01286         pl.set_probeId(j,trans.probeMask[pId]);
01287       }
01288       if(version == 4) {
01289         ProbeListFactory::writeProbeListToSpfFile_v4(outSpf, pl);
01290       }
01291       else {
01292         ChipLayout::writeSpfProbeListRecord(outSpf, pl);
01293       }
01294       working.insert(pl.get_name_string());
01295       written++;
01296     }
01297   }
01298   Verbose::out(2, "Wrote " + ToStr(written) + " probesets");
01299   outSpf.close();
01300   for(set<string>::iterator iter = trans.keepProbeSets.begin(); iter != trans.keepProbeSets.end(); iter++) {
01301     if(working.find(*iter) == working.end()) {
01302       Verbose::out(2,"Couldn't find: " + *iter);
01303     }
01304   }
01305 }
01306 
01307 void openChipLayout(ChipLayout &layout, string &pgfFileStr, string &clfFileStr, string &spfFileStr) {
01308   if(spfFileStr != "") {
01309     Verbose::out(1, "Reading probesets from spf file: " + spfFileStr);
01310     layout.openSpfAll(spfFileStr);
01311   }
01312   else if(pgfFileStr != "") {
01313     if(clfFileStr == "") {
01314       Err::errAbort("If specifying --pgf-file must also specifying --clf-file");
01315     }
01316     ClfFile clfFile;
01317     clfFile.open(clfFileStr);
01318     int xSize = clfFile.getXMax()+1;
01319     int ySize = clfFile.getYMax()+1;
01320     Verbose::out(1, "Reading probesets from pgf file: " + pgfFileStr);
01321     layout.openPgfAll(pgfFileStr, xSize, ySize);
01322   }
01323   else {
01324     Err::errAbort("Must specify specify pgf file or clf file");
01325   }
01326 }
01327 
01328 string makeOutputName(const string &dir, const string &file, const string &prefix, const string &suffix) {
01329   string s;
01330   if(prefix == "") {
01331     s = Fs::join(dir,Util::chopSuffix(Fs::basename(file)) + "." + suffix);
01332   }
01333   else {
01334     s = Fs::join(dir,Util::chopSuffix(Fs::basename(file)) + "." + prefix + "." + suffix);
01335   }
01336   return s;
01337 }
01338 
01339 void readProbesetList(set<string> &toLoad, const string &psFile) {
01340   string probeset;
01341   toLoad.clear();
01342   TsvFile tsv;
01343   // open file and make sure that it has at least a probeset_id column
01344   if(tsv.open(psFile) != TSV_OK) 
01345     Err::errAbort("Couldn't open file: '" + ToStr(psFile) + "'");
01346   tsv.bind(0, "probeset_name", &probeset, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
01347 
01348   set<string> seen;
01349   while(tsv.nextLevel(0) == TSV_OK) {
01350     toLoad.insert(probeset);
01351   }
01352     
01353   tsv.close();
01354 }
01355 
01356 void fillInProbesets(const string &metaFile, vector<Meta> &metaSets,
01357                      ChipLayout &layout, FileTranslation &trans, DsOptions &o) {
01358   if(o.probesetFileStr != "") {
01359     readProbesetList(trans.keepProbeSets, o.probesetFileStr);
01360   }
01361   else if(metaFile.size() > 0) {
01362     Verbose::out(2,"Loading meta probset file: " + o.metaFile);
01363     readMetaProbesetList(metaSets, o.metaFile, o.numKeep);
01364     for(int i = 0; i < metaSets.size(); i++) {
01365       for(int j = 0; j < metaSets[i].probeSets.size(); j++) {
01366         trans.keepProbeSets.insert(metaSets[i].probeSets[j]);
01367       }
01368     }
01369   }
01370   else {
01371     Verbose::out(2, "Selecting " + ToStr(o.numKeep) + " probesets from layout file");
01372     fillPsNamesFromLayout(trans.keepProbeSets, layout, o.numKeep);
01373   }
01374 }
01375 
01376 void loadMagicOrder(FileTranslation &trans, string &col, string &file, string &group) {
01377   
01378   affx::File5_File iFile5;
01379   Verbose::out(2,"Opening " + file + " with group " + group + " to read.");
01380   int ret = 0;
01381   ret = iFile5.open(file, affx::FILE5_OPEN_RO);
01382   if(ret != FILE5_OK) {
01383     Err::errAbort("Couldn't open file: " + file);
01384   }
01385   affx::File5_Group* iGroup5 = iFile5.openGroup(group, affx::FILE5_OPEN);
01386   affx::File5_Tsv* iTsv5 = iGroup5->openTsv(group, affx::FILE5_OPEN);
01387   trans.magicOrder.clear();
01388   trans.magicOrderTranslation.clear();
01389   trans.magicOrderMap.clear();
01390   int cIdx = -1;
01391   int level = 0;
01392   int seenCount = 0;
01393   int convertedCount = 0;
01394   while(iTsv5->nextLevel(level) == FILE5_OK) {
01395     if(cIdx < 0) {
01396       for(int i = 0; i < iTsv5->getColumnCount(level); i++) {
01397         string colName;
01398         iTsv5->getColumnName(level, i, &colName);
01399         if(colName == col) {
01400           cIdx = i;
01401           break;
01402         }
01403       }
01404       if(cIdx < 0) {
01405         Err::errAbort("Index column not found.");
01406       }
01407       else {
01408         Verbose::out(2, "Magic is index: " + ToStr(cIdx));
01409       }
01410     }
01411     string val;
01412     iTsv5->get(level, cIdx, &val);
01413     if(trans.keepProbeSets.find(val) != trans.keepProbeSets.end()) {
01414       trans.magicOrderTranslation.push_back(convertedCount);
01415       trans.magicOrderMap[val] = convertedCount;
01416       trans.magicOrder.push_back(val);
01417       convertedCount++;
01418     }
01419     else {
01420       trans.magicOrderTranslation.push_back(-1);
01421     }
01422     seenCount++;
01423   }
01424   Verbose::out(2, "Magic - Saw: " + ToStr(seenCount) + " converted: " + ToStr(convertedCount));
01425   iTsv5->close();
01426   delete iTsv5;
01427   iGroup5->close();
01428   delete iGroup5;
01429   
01430   iFile5.close();
01431 }
01432 
01433 void dataSubset(PgOptions *opts) {
01434 
01435   DsOptions o(opts);
01436 
01437   if ( !Fs::dirExists(o.libOutputPrefix) ) {
01438     Fs::mkdirPath(o.libOutputPrefix, false);
01439   }
01440   if ( !Fs::dirExists(o.celOutputPrefix) ) {
01441     Fs::mkdirPath(o.celOutputPrefix, false);
01442   }
01443   int numChannels = opts->getInt("num-channels");
01444   int spfVersion = opts->getInt("spf-version");
01445   vector<Meta> metaSets;
01446   FileTranslation trans;
01447   trans.probeSetField = opts->get("probeset-field");
01448   trans.probeField = "probe_id";
01449   trans.chipType = Util::chopSuffix(Fs::basename(o.chipRoot));
01450   if(o.filePrefix != "") 
01451     trans.chipType += "." + o.filePrefix;
01452 
01453   // - Make vector for size of chip, init all to -1
01454   ChipLayout layout;
01455   openChipLayout(layout,o.pgfFileStr, o.clfFileStr, o.spfFileStr);
01456 
01457   trans.probeMask.resize(layout.getXCount() * layout.getYCount());
01458   fill(trans.probeMask.begin(),trans.probeMask.end(),-1);
01459 
01460   /* --- Determine probesets to be kept. --- */
01461 
01462   // First probesets via layout or meta-probesets
01463   if(o.probesetFileStr != "") {
01464     readProbesetList(trans.keepProbeSets, o.probesetFileStr);
01465     o.numKeep = trans.keepProbeSets.size();
01466   }
01467   else {
01468     if(o.numKeep > layout.getProbeSetCount()) 
01469       Err::errAbort("Asked for " + ToStr(o.numKeep) + " but only " + ToStr(layout.getProbeSetCount()) + " probesets.");
01470     fillInProbesets(o.metaFile, metaSets, layout, trans, o);
01471   }
01472 
01473 
01474 
01475   // Add in any qcc probesets
01476   if(o.qccFileStr != "") {
01477     Verbose::out(2, "Selecting " + ToStr(o.numKeep) + " probesets from qcc file");
01478     readProbesetTsvFile(o.qccFileStr, trans, o.numKeep);
01479   }
01480 
01481   if(o.file5SelectFileFile != "") {
01482     vector<File5Options> file5Conv;
01483     fillInFile5Files(file5Conv, o.file5SelectFileFile);
01484     for(int i = 0; i < file5Conv.size(); i++) {
01485       readProbesetFile5File(file5Conv[i], trans);
01486     }
01487   }
01488   
01489   if(o.tsvSelectFileFile != "") {
01490     vector<string> tsvFiles;
01491     vector<string> ids;
01492     fillInTsvFiles(tsvFiles,ids, o.tsvSelectFileFile);
01493     for(int i = 0; i < tsvFiles.size(); i++) {
01494       trans.pOffset = 1;
01495       string id = trans.probeSetField;
01496       if(ids[i] != "")
01497         trans.probeSetField = ids[i];
01498       readProbesetTsvFile(tsvFiles[i], trans, o.numKeep);
01499       trans.probeSetField = id;
01500     }
01501   }
01502   
01503 
01504   // - Mark the bgp probes as needing to be kept as well
01505   if(o.bgpFile.size() > 0) {
01506     Verbose::out(1, "Reading bgp file: " + o.bgpFile);
01507     setBgpFile(trans, o.bgpFile);
01508   }
01509 
01510   // - Make a mask mapping old probes to new ones from list of probesets
01511   trans.fillInFromProbeSets(layout);
01512   
01513   // - Determine new size of cel file
01514   trans.calcDimensions(trans.totalProbes);
01515 
01516   // - Figure out magic orderings for copynumber if desired
01517   if(o.magicOrderColStr != "") {
01518     loadMagicOrder(trans, o.magicOrderColStr, o.magicOrderFileStr, o.magicOrderGroupStr);
01519   }
01520 
01521   /*  ---- For each library file write a smaller one ---- */
01522 
01523   // Chip Layout file, either pgf or spf
01524   if(o.spfFileStr != "") {
01525     string outputSpf = makeOutputName(o.libOutputPrefix, o.spfFileStr, o.filePrefix, "spf");
01526     Verbose::out(1,"Writing new spf file: " + outputSpf);
01527     writeSpfFile(layout, outputSpf, trans, spfVersion, numChannels);
01528   }
01529   if(o.pgfFileStr != "") {
01530     string pgfFileOut = makeOutputName(o.libOutputPrefix, o.pgfFileStr, o.filePrefix, "pgf");
01531     string clfFileOut = makeOutputName(o.libOutputPrefix, o.clfFileStr, o.filePrefix, "clf");
01532     map<string,string> pgfHeaders;
01533     pgfHeaders.insert(pair<string,string>("chip_type", trans.chipType));
01534     pgfHeaders.insert(pair<string,string>("rows", ToStr(trans.nRow)));
01535     pgfHeaders.insert(pair<string,string>("cols", ToStr(trans.nCol)));
01536     pgfHeaders.insert(pair<string,string>("probesets", ToStr(trans.keepProbeSets.size())));
01537     trans.pOffset = 1;
01538     Verbose::out(1,"Writing new pgf file: " + pgfFileOut);
01539     copyTsvFile(o.pgfFileStr, pgfFileOut, pgfHeaders, trans);
01540     Verbose::out(1,"Writing new clf file: " + clfFileOut);
01541     copyTsvFile(o.clfFileStr, clfFileOut, pgfHeaders, trans);
01542 
01543   }
01544 
01545   // Write out meta sets if set
01546   if(metaSets.size() > 0) {
01547     string metaOutput =  makeOutputName(o.libOutputPrefix, o.metaFile, o.filePrefix, "mps");
01548     Verbose::out(1,"Writing new meta-probeset file: " + metaOutput);
01549     writeMetaProbesets(metaSets, metaOutput, trans.chipType);
01550   }
01551 
01552   // Write a new qcc file if supplied
01553   if(o.qccFileStr != "") {
01554     string qccOutput = makeOutputName(o.libOutputPrefix, o.qccFileStr,  o.filePrefix, "qcc");
01555     map<string,string> qccHeaders;
01556     qccHeaders.insert(pair<string,string>("chip_type", trans.chipType));
01557     Verbose::out(1, "Writing new qcc file: " + qccOutput);
01558     trans.pOffset = 0;
01559     copyTsvFile(o.qccFileStr, qccOutput, qccHeaders, trans);
01560   }
01561 
01562   // - Write new bgp file if supplied
01563   if(o.bgpFile.size() > 0) {
01564     string bgpOutput = makeOutputName(o.libOutputPrefix, o.bgpFile, o.filePrefix, "bgp");
01565     map<string,string> bgpHeaders;
01566     bgpHeaders.insert(pair<string,string>("chip_type", trans.chipType));
01567     Verbose::out(1, "Writing new bgp file: " + bgpOutput);
01568     trans.pOffset = 1;
01569     copyTsvFile(o.bgpFile, bgpOutput, bgpHeaders, trans);
01570   }
01571   // - Write new kill list file if supplied
01572   if(o.killFileStr.size() > 0) {
01573     string killListOutput =  makeOutputName(o.libOutputPrefix, o.killFileStr, o.filePrefix, "txt");
01574     map<string,string> killHeaders;
01575     Verbose::out(1, "Writing new kill-list file: " + killListOutput);
01576     trans.pOffset = 1;
01577     copyTsvFile(o.killFileStr, killListOutput, killHeaders, trans);
01578   }
01579 
01580   if(o.file5ConvertFileFile != "") {
01581     vector<File5Options> file5Conv;
01582     fillInFile5Files(file5Conv, o.file5ConvertFileFile);
01583     for(int i = 0; i < file5Conv.size(); i++) {
01584       string suffix = file5Conv[i].fileName.substr(file5Conv[i].fileName.rfind(".")+1,file5Conv[i].fileName.size());
01585       string outputName = makeOutputName(o.libOutputPrefix, file5Conv[i].fileName, o.filePrefix, suffix);
01586       Verbose::out(2, "Starting processing of file: " + file5Conv[i].fileName + " group: " + file5Conv[i].groupName);
01587       copyFile5File(file5Conv[i], outputName, trans);
01588       Verbose::out(2, "Finished processing file: " + file5Conv[i].fileName + " group: " + file5Conv[i].groupName);
01589     }
01590   }
01591 
01592   if(o.tsvConvertFileFile != "") {
01593     vector<string> tsvFiles;
01594     vector<string> ids;
01595     fillInTsvFiles(tsvFiles, ids, o.tsvConvertFileFile);
01596     for(int i = 0; i < tsvFiles.size(); i++) {
01597       string suffix = tsvFiles[i].substr(tsvFiles[i].rfind(".")+1,tsvFiles[i].size());
01598       string outputName = makeOutputName(o.libOutputPrefix, tsvFiles[i], o.filePrefix, suffix);
01599       Verbose::out(2, "Writing from: " + Fs::basename(tsvFiles[i]) + " into: " + outputName);
01600       trans.pOffset = 1;
01601       map<string,string> pgfHeaders;
01602       pgfHeaders.insert(pair<string,string>("chip_type", trans.chipType));
01603       pgfHeaders.insert(pair<string,string>("rows", ToStr(trans.nRow)));
01604       pgfHeaders.insert(pair<string,string>("cols", ToStr(trans.nCol)));
01605       pgfHeaders.insert(pair<string,string>("probesets", ToStr(trans.keepProbeSets.size())));
01606       string id = trans.probeSetField;
01607       if(ids[i] != "")
01608         trans.probeSetField = ids[i];
01609       copyTsvFile(tsvFiles[i], outputName, pgfHeaders, trans);
01610       trans.probeSetField = id;
01611     }
01612   }
01613 
01614   // - For each cel file write a smaller one
01615   vector<string> celFiles;
01616   fillInCelFiles(celFiles, o.celFileFile);
01617   for(int i = 0; i < celFiles.size(); i++) {
01618     // string rootName = Util::chopSuffix(Fs::basename(celFiles[i]));
01619     string suffix = celFiles[i].substr(celFiles[i].rfind(".")+1,celFiles[i].size());
01620     string outputName = makeOutputName(o.celOutputPrefix, celFiles[i], o.filePrefix, suffix);
01621     Verbose::out(2, "Writing from: " + Fs::basename(celFiles[i]) + " into: " + outputName);
01622     //makeCelFileSubset(celFiles[i], outputName, trans);
01623     subsetCelFile(celFiles[i], outputName, trans);
01624   }
01625   Verbose::out(1, "Done.");
01626 }
01627 
01628 /** Everybody's favorite function. */
01629 int main(int argc, const char *argv[]) {
01630   const string version = AptVersionInfo::versionToReport();
01631 
01632   PgOptions *opts = NULL;
01633   opts = new PgOptions();
01634   defineDataSubsetOptions(opts);
01635   opts->parseArgv(argv);
01636   Verbose::setLevel(opts->getInt("verbose"));
01637   // Do we need help?
01638   if(opts->getBool("help") || argc == 1) {
01639     opts->usage();
01640     cout << "version: " << version << endl;
01641   }
01642   else if(opts->getBool("version"))
01643     cout << "version: " << version << endl;
01644   else
01645     dataSubset(opts);
01646   delete opts;
01647   return 0;
01648 }
